title: 108_s2333
content: The "Criminal Gang Activity Act of 2004" amends Section 922(g) of title 18, United States Code to include participation in a criminal street gang as a prohibited offense. Section 922 of title 18, United States Code is amended to define a "criminal street gang" as a group of 3 or more individuals who commit 2 or more predicate gang crimes, affecting interstate commerce. The amended Section 922 of title 18, United States Code defines a "criminal street gang" as a group of 3 or more individuals committing 2 or more predicate gang crimes, including acts punishable by imprisonment for more than 1 year under various federal or state laws. These acts involve offenses such as murder, kidnapping, robbery, extortion, arson, obstruction of justice, tampering with witnesses, sexual assault, and drug-related crimes. The amended Section 922 of title 18, United States Code defines a "criminal street gang" as a group committing multiple predicate gang crimes, including serious violent felonies, serious drug offenses, and various other criminal activities such as fraud, obstruction of justice, and interference with criminal investigations. The amended Section 922 of title 18, United States Code defines a "criminal street gang" as a group committing multiple predicate gang crimes, including serious violent felonies, serious drug offenses, and various other criminal activities such as fraud, obstruction of justice, and interference with criminal investigations. This includes offenses related to interference with commerce, robbery, extortion, racketeering, money laundering, engaging in monetary transactions from unlawful activities, use of interstate commerce facilities in murder-for-hire, and interstate transportation of stolen vehicles or property. It also encompasses acts involving the Immigration and Nationality Act related to harboring certain aliens and aiding or assisting certain aliens to enter the United States. The term 'State' refers to the various States of the United States, the District of Columbia, and any commonwealth, territory, or possession of the United States. 'Participates in a criminal street gang' is defined as committing multiple predicate gang crimes in furtherance of gang activities or for gaining entrance to or maintaining position in the gang. The curr_chunk describes the act of employing, commanding, or coercing individuals to commit gang-related crimes in support of a criminal street gang or to gain status within the gang.
